channel.title: Art and Design Feedback - Last Stand of the Dream Gaurd
channel.description:
Last Stand of the Dream guard is a tragedy adventure for [@6d6Fireball](https://twitter.com/6d6Fireball/) It's nearly done, so here are some art previews, on which I'd like some feedback. Does my intention come through? Is the art tragic and/or dramatic?
As the characters are toys, it made sense to use a sprue to represent pieces that should be put together. This also mimics the way 6d6 2nd Ed builds characters from component parts. ![LSDG-art-preview-page002|690x487, 75%](upload://bmP1gTVb3J579ls4LynoUisKJUB.jpeg)
The fourth phase of the adventure is about the enemy trying to break into the character’s stronghold. This image is a colourised version of a street art that said “shattering” to me. The text is placed so that it is breaking onto or through the page. ![LSDG-art-preview-page003|690x487,75%](upload://noa2eZ8FnRKduYYEliMkojDBjP9.jpeg)
Here, the microbe menaces the text into the bottom right corner. In phase 5 the enemy are every closer and their number are innumerable. I like how the microbe both crowds the text but there’s still white space on the page. ![LSDG-art-preview-page004|690x487,75%](upload://9QKaHuHgSfF0y03mwXVVbARD6B9.jpeg)
A simpler graphic for phase 6, in which the final attack begins before the sun rises. We’ve gone for a literal graphic to represent the phase title. ![LSDG-art-preview-page005|690x487,75%](upload://qrP86Iyuzqaosz9tARiboGwaZ77.jpeg)
In the end, we come to Dawn and the Aftermath. The flag is upside down to unsettle you and make space for the text in the lower third. ![LSDG-art-preview-page006|690x487, 75%](upload://5W6p0taQDPS6qPkXv7lFo4NcvP5.jpeg)

item.title: Art and Design Feedback - Last Stand of the Dream Gaurd
item.dc:creator: @Chall
item.description:
@Chall wrote:

I like the sprue for the character creation graphic. However, maybe find one that has humanoid parts? Like something from a robot model kit. The graphic itself suggests I’m building a vehicle for my character, but not the charter themselves.

It is, however, otherwise evocative, as are the other graphics. Other than than what I commented above, I think they’re fine choices.

item.title: Art and Design Feedback - Last Stand of the Dream Gaurd
item.dc:creator: @Nickwedig
item.description:
@Nickwedig wrote:

The shape of the flag in the last image visually reminds me of the famous map of Napoleon’s campaign (which has been called the best infographic ever made): https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/Minard.png/1920px-Minard.png

Which seems to tie thematically into the game, what with it being a doomed military campaign as well.

So it reads as dramatic and tragic to me, for that reason. But I don’t know if anyone else would make that connection in their head when seeing the image.

item.title: Art and Design Feedback - Last Stand of the Dream Gaurd
item.dc:creator: @Radmad
item.description:
@Radmad wrote:

My gut reaction is that the gritty/graininess of the chargen and phase 4 pages clash with the high clarity/photos of the next chapters. I think either can work for communicating a message, the grittiness can show a pain and suffering to the text, while the photography and stark graphic design of phase 6 can communicate an unyielding reality, something that can be struggled against with no hope for change.

Seeing as majority of the art previewed gives me the latter feeling, I would lean towards replacing the earlier art with more photorealistic images: instead of fuzzying the sprues perhaps increase the contrast so that the shadows become sharp and deep. For phase 4 perhaps replace the street art with an actual photo of shattered glass + red filter.

Just my 2 cents, I would love to hear more about your intention and how close I was to grasping it.
